content.question: The author’s statement that descendants of Italian emigrants “ended up forgetting the language of their fathers and forefathers” most directly refers to which of the following aspects of nineteenth-century migration?

choices.label: Some receiving societies attempted to limit the flow of immigrants.
Some colonial states applied theories of Social Darwinism to establish racial preferences.
Immigrants often adopted the dominant culture of the state in receiving societies.
Immigrants often maintained some aspects of their religion within ethnic enclaves.

content.answer: Immigrants often adopted the dominant culture of the state in receiving societies.

topic.text: 6.6: Causes of Migration in an Interconnected World
